thread.title: Algeria: Building Materials - Nearly 30 Percent Drop in Import Bill in First Seven Months of 2015
thread.title_full: Algeria: Building Materials - Nearly 30 Percent Drop in Import Bill in First Seven Months of 2015

title: Algeria: Building Materials - Nearly 30 Percent Drop in Import Bill in First Seven Months of 2015
text:
Egypt: Suicide Bombing 'Thwarted' in North Sinai, Assailant Killed - Interior Ministry 
Cement imports declined by 13.03% in terms of value, totalling US$ 352.93 million during the first seven months of 2014 against US$ 306.94 million during the same period in 2015, and dropped by 4.43% in terms of quantity, moving from 3.83 million tonnes down to 3.66 million tonnes during the same period of reference, according to figures provided by CNIS. 
The same downward trend was recorded in wood import, which decreased from US$ 522.45 million (924,653 tonnes) to US$ 369.36 million (807,503 tonnes), i.e. down by 29.3% in terms of value and by 12.67% in terms of quantity. 
The most significant drop was recorded in iron and steel import bill, which totalled US$ 786.76 million during the first seven months of 2015, against US$ 1.19 billion during the same period a year earlier, down by 34.37%. 
The quantity of imported iron and steel dropped by 8.56%, from 1.84 million tonnes from January to July 2014 down to 1.68 million tonnes during the same period in 2015. 
Algeria's imports of building materials amounted to US$ 3.65 billion in 2014, against US$ 3.43 billion in 2013, up by +6.4%. Algeria
